article: ## HTML5 Text Formatting Tags ### Contents - [Introduction](#introduction) - [Objective and Scope](#objective-and-scope) - [Requirements and Pre-requisites](#requirements-and-pre-requisites) - [Step-by-Step Instructions](#step-by-step-instructions) - [Code Snippets and Commands](#code-snippets-and-commands) - [Troubleshooting and Common Issues](#troubleshooting-and-common-issues) - [Best Practices and Recommendations](#best-practices-and-recommendations) - [Summary and Conclusion](#summary-and-conclusion) ### Introduction HTML5 is the latest version of the HTML (Hypertext Markup Language) standard, which is used for creating the structure and content of web pages. HTML5 introduced several new text formatting tags that provide more semantic meaning to the content and improve accessibility. ### Objective and Scope The objective of this documentation is to provide a comprehensive guide on HTML5 text formatting tags. This documentation will cover the usage and syntax of various text formatting tags and provide examples to illustrate their implementation. ### Requirements and Pre-requisites To follow along with the examples and instructions in this documentation, you will need: - A text editor to write HTML code. - A web browser to view the HTML pages. ### Step-by-Step Instructions 1. **Bold Text**: To make text bold, use the `` or `` tag. For example: ```html WHO ``` ### Code Snippets and Commands No specific code snippets or commands are required for the usage of HTML5 text formatting tags. ### Troubleshooting and Common Issues - Make sure to use the correct syntax for each text formatting tag. - Check for any missing opening or closing tags. - Verify that the HTML file is properly saved with the `.html` extension. - Ensure that the web browser supports HTML5. ### Best Practices and Recommendations - Use text formatting tags sparingly and only when they add semantic meaning to the content. - Avoid using text formatting tags for purely presentational purposes. - Test the web page in different browsers to ensure consistent rendering. - Consider the accessibility implications of text formatting tags and provide alternative text or descriptions where necessary. ### Summary and Conclusion HTML5 text formatting tags provide a way to add semantic meaning to the content of web pages. By using these tags appropriately, you can enhance the readability and accessibility of your web pages. Remember to use them judiciously and consider the best practices and recommendations to ensure a well-structured and user-friendly website.
